comments.body: what does adding this namespace give you?

Saves a lot of export clauses and isolates the oracle things from other things (it have some global variables that could cause redefinition in some cases)
Increments were discused [here](https://github.com/typings/registry/pull/651) and [here](https://github.com/typings/registry/pull/734).
Because DefinitelyTyped was deprecated in favor of typings, this new versions were published at typings registry and not here in DefinitelyTyped.
The main reference to this definitions can be found [here](https://github.com/oracle/node-oracledb/issues/169).
As the new @types arrived in typescript 2, and it automatically published from the older definitions from DefinitelyTyped, I was told by ms people to make a PR here in types-2.0 branch.
And the repo I created to update this definitions is [here](https://github.com/Bigous/typed-oracledb)
I still do not think this does any thing. the file is a module, it has its own scope. so no need for isolation.
